byline.contributor: Mujib Mashal and Zahra Nader reported from Kabul, and Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan. Ihsanullah Tipu Mehsud contributed reporting from Islamabad, Pakistan.
byline.original: By MUJIB MASHAL, TAIMOOR SHAH and ZAHRA NADER

abstract: Taliban announces lesser-known deputy Mawlawi Haibatullah Akhundzada will take over as leader and confirms Mullah Akhtar Muhammad Mansour was killed in drone strike in Pakistan; appointment of conservative cleric, who is seen as throwback to group's core religious values, comes as surprise to many Taliban commanders.

headline.main: Taliban Name Lesser-Known Cleric as Their New Leader

snippet: The insurgency confirmed its former leader’s death in a drone strike, and it said the new one, Mawlawi Haibatullah Akhundzada, would continue the war.
lead_paragraph: The insurgency confirmed its former leader’s death in a drone strike, and it said the new one, Mawlawi Haibatullah Akhundzada, would continue the war.
